column2: thixotropic, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Caregiver)
column9: This medication is worthless for many people's pain and is EXTREMELY HABITUATING. If you are taking this drug and find yourself taking more and more pills, PLEASE SWITCH TO THE VERSION WITH NO ACETAMINOPHEN (TRAMADOL) as you are destroying your liver with the acetaminophen! You *can* get off this drug -- do it by slowly tapering on a schedule. The last bit is the hardest, but you can do it! It'll be 3-4 nights of extreme discomfort at the end but then it will be over. You *can* get off this stuff; I did!The reason it is so addictive has nothing to do with its opioid effects -- it's the serotonergic/adrenergic effects that make the withdrawal such hell. I have developed a short-term regimen for people quitting this drug that uses 5HTP, dl-phenylalanine, clonazepam, and hydrocodone and have gotten 4 people completely off this drug. It can be done.

column9: Have been taking Vicoden for knee pain due to athritus and tear in tissue between bone. I can not take anti-inflamitory drugs. The Ultracet works 100 times better than the vicoden. column2: Playerlucky, 45-54 Female  (Patient)
Kate1953, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I began to use Ultracet medication prior to rotator cuff surgery and continued after. I have been helped overall but it has not helped deep muscle pain or the pain right after my surgery.  I fractured a rib several months ago and Ultracet didn't help at all.  I took Tylenol #3 for that with great results. My shoulder surgery was over a year ago and if I overdo with my shoulder, I get pain. Ultracet does help as long as I take it in combination with Ibuprofen. Works pretty well. I also have Fibromyalgia and I am in the middle of a painful episode and had to take the Tylenol #3 for two days in a row. Today, I took the Ultracet with the ibuprofen and it has relieved the burning and aching in my right leg.  Pain is not gone but it is acceptable.Tylenol #3 does not make me drowsy and I get sure relief from it but I don't want to increase my tolerance to it or rely on it too much, so I don't take it unless nothing else works. I have had one doctor tell me that Ultracet has a bad "rebound" effect, as in pain being worse after taking it and then the med not relieving it. I haven't had this happen. Just in the past year or so have I become aware of how much physical pain I was dealing with on a daily basis and didn't realize it. So, if you are hurting, get some answers and don't stop til you find relief. Bother them, leave messages with their nurses, go see them and tell them what is happening. Maybe you need a specialist. Don't stop til you find help!

column2: nursemom, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: I was dx with fibromyalgia and degenerative disc about 10 yrs ago. I would go to my Drs. office barely able to move or function in my daily life. I had to keep working. He would prescribe pain med such as Vicodin, Percocet, etc. All they did was make me want to sleep. Finally I went to a rheumatologist that prescribed Ultracet. It changed my life. I am down to usually only 2 pills a day, unless I overdo and have a bad flareup. I can work, drive, and take care of my family. I did have some stomach upset in the beginning. My only complaint is that I think it is causing sweating and more severe "hot flashes". If you suffer from fibro or other chronic pain this is a great drug. I don't knowthat it would be so effective on acute pain, such as surgical.

column2: Faith, 65-74 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I have osteoarthritis and fibromalgia also flare ups with sciatica..I took nasaids  with little relief. I had a tia and sometimes that is related to the nasaids so I went off all pain meds. My Dr. Put me on ultracet smallest dose 2 every 6 hours or as needed, meaning I can take less not more. I have never had to take more than 4 a day, For the first time in many years I am not suffering with constant pain.I can function normally. What a gift. If I have any side effects I am not aware of it. So they must be minimal.I think this med. is safe . Just be careful to take as your Dr. Perscribed.I am careful to eat a little something before taking like a half slice bread or crackers.Anyway I am grateful to my Dr. for finding the answer to my constant pain.I have cried many times because of it ..Constant pain itself is dangerous.Depressing and dibilating.I am hoping they do not take this medicine off the market because of the few who do not do things appropriately.and get into trouble .. I do not think its the medicine ..I think its the inability to stay in touch with your Dr. and to not follow instructions.Thanks for letting me express this and I hope it helps people.

column2: The Captain, 55-64 Male  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I requested a switch from Vicodin for pain due to several herniated discs due to fire truck accident.  Vicodin made me feel like there was a balloon on my shoulders and I was not "functional" in the real world.  I take an extremely low dose am and pm of everyday and have successfully managed most of the acute pain associated with the disc problem.  Recently I have been concerned about having taken it for more than a year and I have slowly weened myself off, perferring to use it for "flair-ups".  Much like Naproxin (sp?)it seems to be more effective at a lower dose when taken routinely.  Not recommended by manufacturer but very effective none the less...I recommend you try it if you are having trouble with other pain meds, especially Vicodin.  In talking to others, it seems it is one or the other in satisfaction.

column2: gl2mll, 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I was prescribed this med after a work injury requiring a microdiscectomy of L1 and L2. Chronic pain persisted but this med releaves 75% of it. No ill aftereffects. After taking for 3 years dr. wanted me to taper off my dosage (2pills every 6 hr.) I cut this in half and experienced return of pain as well as moderate withdrawl symptoms such as anxiety and moodiness. I bumped the dose to 1 pill every 4 hrs. and the withdrawl lessened. I will gradually continue to taper off but would not hesitate to take this again at full dosage if pain dictates. Nothing else short of strong narcotics has been as effective. Side benefit is that it also releaves pain from torn ACL in right knee from injury long ago.

column2: Kittychan, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)

column2: Meesh, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I have suffered from tension headaches for years..i think it's associated with allergies too.  About a year or two ago I finally decided to go to the MD and they prescribed me meds such as vicodin and something similar, which made me just feel drugged.  A friend of mine had ultracet and made me try it and to my surprise it took my headache away within 20 minutes.  I now have had a prescription of my own and love it. I don't take it on a regular basis (only when the heachache is unbearable) and i only take a half of pill.I highly recommend this medication and have suggested coworkers and friends ask thieir MD about this drug if suffering from constant headaches.The only side effect i've seen it that it makes me a little more hyper than usual...which sometime is good, becuase headaches can wear you down!I highly recommend this medication for people suffering from moderate to severe headaches on a regular basis.

column2: 19-24 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I have been on this medication for 5 days now, and I may as well have been eating tic-tacs. I have disk problems from a car accident and a pinched nerve. other than making me unsociable ultracet hasn't helped a bit. My advice if your doctor writes you an Rx for ultracet, give it back and get vicodin. Ps: headaches and gastrointestinal problems likely.

column2: theprincessofdoom, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: used for internal disk disruption and discogenic pain, during the conservative treatment phase, in the hopes of avoiding surgery. i am currently on my first full day of ultracet, and i am quite satisfied with the relief i have gotten. i am concerned at just how tired it makes me, and how...loopy, for lack of a better word, but quite honestly, i'd rather be loopy than in pain. after six months, even the random falling asleep feeling is welcome. :)

column2: kevin, 35-44 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: did not help with my pain at all

column2: grumpyolady@msn.com, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I'm not sure if this is a side effect from this medication but for the last 3 days (when I started it)I have had real bad intestional gas. Other wise I have had no other problems with it but like I said, I have only been on it for 3 days! If anyone else has experienced this side effect please email me @ grumpyolady@msn.com thanks!

column2: NicoleC, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I took this medication only 2 times, and I may as well have taken nothing at all.  I was recovering from ear/head surgery, and my dr didn't feel comfortable giving me anything narcotic. It actually made me feel WORSE than I did before taking it.  I felt faint, sick to my stomach and so dizzy I couldn't stand for over 3 hrs! I called my dr immediately and he changed my Rx to Vicodin, which has been a life saver. I've never gotten sick since then, and I know that Ultracet was to blame.  I'd not recommend this to anyone for any reason.

column2: 25-34 Male  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I get migraines from time to time and it really helps with the pain.  Only thing is it makes me sweat a little but I will take that over the head aches.

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: THIS MEDICATION GAVE ME SEVER HEADACHES.

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I experienced tremors, nausea and seizures.  Total loss of control of motor functions along with impairement speech.

column2: 25-34 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I was given this drug for back pain, It dosn't work at all. In the corse of a day I take 10 to 12 and still dosnt relive any of the pain. And as a bonus it gives me panic attacks when I sleep.

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Torn rotator cuff.  Not much is helping just yet.  This med is better than percocet.

column2: SOUPY, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: ULTRACET HAS CONTROLLED MY CHRONIC COUGH THAT NOTHING ELSE HELPED. ONE TABLET WORKS ABOUT 12 HOURS.  I DO NOT TAKE IT NEAR BEDTIME BECAUSE IT KEEPS ME AWAKE.  I HAVE USED IT ABOUT 4 YEARS.

column2: PGK, 35-44 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I have been prescribed this for sciatica pain. Was first on Noproxen, which wore off after about 6 hours. Started this and it really does not eliminate the pain but lessens it from a 10 to a 7 but only for a couple of hours. I was expecting more from it. Takes about 45 minutes to kick in, then lasts about 2.5 hours and then wears off. I actually look forward to the next dose and take it every 5 hours instead of 6 as prescribed. A bit of tiredness and light-headed along with itching on my thigh and moodiness, which may actually be from the pain still being present. Decreases appetite as well and gives dry mouth feeling for which I find myself drinking quite a bit of water. Looking to get off of it and on to something else ASAP.

column2: sandy72461, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I have lupus.  This is my miracle drug.  It does not make me sleepy and I can function in my life like a normal person.  I only take this when I need it because it is an addicting drug as many pain relievers are.  I would recommend this medication to anyone who suffers from a horrible and debilitating disease like LUPUS!!!!!

column2: stcart, 45-54 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: This medication did not help...at all.  If I took it I got a horrible headache.  If i ALREADY had a headache..it took it away.  Did NOTHING for the pain in my leg and back tho.  Took two at a time, every three hours from 10AM until 10PM..12/day.  After 5 days, and 60 of them, I stopped.  Doctor prescribed Percocet 10's, and they were 10X better.  Only had to take one of them every 4 hours.

column2: 35-44 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months
column9: All this med does is make you nauses and make you feel sick. It does not really help with pain. I think these pills are a joke. These doctors should take these to see howw ill you get.

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: Started taking ultracet for back pain. I developed fibromyalgia. The ultracet helps tremendously with my overall pain. It makes me feel normal and able to get through my daily routine. My concern is that I am addicted to ultracet. When I don't take it or it wears off I get anxious and the pain comes back. I literally have to take it in the middle of the night so I wake up able to get out of bed. I've been taking ultracet for over 5 years. I get my liver checked periodically. Overall, I am happy with Ultracet.

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month
column9: presc for fractured wrist. makes me feel high and flighty,a little nauseated- but it does help with pain. i take 1/3 the prescribed dose= 1/3 of a pill. 1 whole pill lierally put me right to sleep after i hallucinaterd.  sorry, typing with my left handonly.

column2: dcbaileydesigns, 25-34 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month
column9: It has not relieved any pain in my shoulder at all

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: It works most of the time for my joint pain.  It does work best if you take on regular basis before pain is full blown again.

column2: Dub1979, 25-34 Male  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I had a compression fracture of my T-12 vertebral body in 2002. I was so stubborn, I didn't ever go to a doctor for it. I was only diagnosed with the fracture 3 years later when I tried a chiropractor to fix my pain. I was in excruciating pain 24/7 and didn't want to move, much less ride 40 minutes to the nearest decent emergency room. Luckily, my sister is a registered nurse, and had access to samples of several medications. I tried oxycodone, it knocked me out. Hydrocodone made me itch. When I first tried Ultracet, one pill per day allowed me to lie still without any pain, and after a couple of weeks, it allowed me to walk without pain. It never made me feel "good" or better than normal, just normal. It never made me sleepy or twitchy. And once the bone healed, I didn't need any again until I did something to upset my back. Then all I had to do was take ONE! and my pain was gone until I upset it again, which could be a matter of months. I had 15 two pill packs that lasted me 18 months. Judging by a lot of these reviews, many people/conditions are not compatible with Ultracet, but I definitely am. I would recommend it to anyone to try in the safety of their own home. If you don't trust it, have someone watch you.

column2: sandy, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month
column9: The pain is gone but I can barely keep my eyes open and the feeling of nausea is worsening.  Have gone from 1 pill to half a pill and I still feel sick.  Call into Dr and I'm off this med ASAP

column2: Casey, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have Lupus and this has helped so much. It takes the edge off the pain , gives me energy so Iam not feeling tired all the time. I can drive and work and play with mt kids.

column2: Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I took this medication after gall bladder surgery.  It did ABSOLUTELY NOTHING for the pain.  It didn't make me tired either and I just wanted to sleep.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I had a mole removed from my toe and was given this medicine for pain. I took one pill one time and it did nothing for the pain, made me dizzy and tired, when I woke up I felt faint and nearly passed out.

column2: scott, 35-44 Male  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I have been using ultracet for almost two years for neck pain and headaches.  I have been very satisified with the results.  I take two tablets and the pain is gone for the entire day.  Sometimes if I drink too much caffenine I get a little light headed.  I would highly recommend this drug to anyone.

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: at first it worked well for the pain, then after the 4th day of use went into sevear depretion. ended up trying to od on the drugs due to the depretion it coused.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Be very careful when taking this drug. I took one pill for pain, and three hours later I was vomiting, shaking, felt really nervous, and had trouble breathing. It was quite scary, almost went to the hospital. I was not taking any other medicines at the time, nor am I allergic to any other medications. I will never use this drug again.

column2: Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I was given this medication for shoulder/collar pain/injury and released from the ER.  Nurse said I could drive, I almost fell asleep before getting home.  It has made me an emotional wreck.  It knocks me into almost a coma when I take it.  Today my eye started switching.

column2: mona lane, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: No stomach upset, was able to work and drive while taking it.

column2: HatesPain, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I started taking Ultracet in 2004. I had a 65 lb box fall on me and still suffer from neck pain and headaches.  This is the only medication that alleviates the pain without knocking me out. I have had withdrawal symptoms when I run out (twitching, stomach cramps and severe moodiness). I take 6-8 a day and am able to be myself.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: I have been taking Ultracet on and off for 7 years for chronic pain...ever since I had a C1-C2 fusion.  I am surprised at the negative reviews because this is the only pain medicine that has worked for me. It is not controlled or super strong like a narcotic, but offers pain control w/o putting you into a medicine coma. And it does elavate your mood slightly, which helps when pain makes you cranky...

column2: hizflame, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I was taking this for osteoarthritis in my knee, it worked fine except when I would take it with my ambien (used as a sleep aid) then I would see things that weren't there (beautiful cloud floating across my bedroom ceiling) my family found it very entertaining. I did not agree.

column2: valentinadawn, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have been taking this med for about 4 months it helps but does not last long I find myself taking more before I should have to,it does not make me sleepy but sometimes does make me feel sick I just ask my DR for a new pain med and Im hoping it works better their are just way to many side affects for this pain med and its attended for short term use not long term.

column2: DELENAB, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: I HAVE TAKEN THIS DRUG FOR GOING ON 5 YEARS I AM NOW UP TO 280 PILLS A MONTH, THIS IS THE MOST ADDICTIVE PILL I HAVE EVER TAKEN; ITS SEEMS TO BE A MIRACLE DRUG AT FIRST BECOUSE OF THE HIGHTEND FEELING AFTER TAKING IT. BUT THE WITHDRAWLS FROM THIS PILL IS NOT WORTH THE RELIEF

column2: 45-54 Male  (Patient)

column2: cmancini, 45-54 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)

column2: MTMom1953, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I have Multiple Sclerosis and have a lot of Pheripheral Neuropathy in my legs and joint pain all over. Ultracet in combination with Cymbalta(antidepressant, but has shown very good results for neuropathy pain),has really helped me. Ultracet has never totally relieved the pain, but takes the edge off and I can function without the drugged feeling with other pain meds. It works for me.
works great for my pain but i can't sleep

column2: 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I was taking 1 pill four times a day and it did not control the total body pain I have.  I now take 2 pills twice daily (sometimes even once daily).  That dose helps me tremendously!  I feel like a new person.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: After taking the recommended dose the pain was gone.  However, I got severe dizziness, nausea even after taking the medicine with food.  I will try sleeping immediately after taking to see if that helps.

No side effects felt.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)

column2: terzaju, 35-44 Male  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
